string.text: Heavy Pockets
Traders are more willing to sell higher tier gear to you, even if you don't meet the goodwill requirements with their faction.
Your great wealth has become well-known among the traders of the Zone. Eager for your patronage, they're more likely to offer their best wares to you, regardless of your standing with their faction.
You have unlocked the "Heavy Pockets" achievement.
Radiotherapy
Each time a psy-storm or emission begins, there's a chance you won't need to take cover.
Your mind has numbed to the whispers, and you no longer fear the approach of emissions or psy-storms. At times, their arrival even brings you peace.
You have unlocked the "Radiotherapy" achievement.
Infopreneur
Brokers will now pay you a small bonus for any further PDAs you deliver to them.
Artefacts are flashy, but knowledge is where the true power lies. Having learned this through experience, you're able to charge more for the secrets you sell.
You have unlocked the "Infopreneur" achievement.
Duga Free
Stalkers are more likely to move through Yantar and Radar, possibly increasing their population in northern areas.

After seeing what reckless experimentation had brought to the Zone of Alienation, you chose to shut down some of its decaying science projects. With two major psy-fields disabled, paths through Yantar and Radar are now more accessible than ever.
You have unlocked the "Duga Free" achievement.
Well Dressed
You are able to skin mutants much faster than normal.
Rightly so does the Zone's wildlife fear you - more than a fair share have fallen at your hands. Practiced hands make for swift work, and you've grown practiced indeed.
You have unlocked the "Well Dressed" achievement.
Silver or Lead
Surrendering stalkers may occasionally reveal the location of a second stash.

Bodies and bullet casings litter the tracks behind you. Your enemies know you as a remorseless killer. Those who survive your horrifying onslaughts are now much more willing to part with their goods if it means living to see another day.
You have unlocked the "Silver or Lead" achievement.
Mechanized Warfare
Bonus items used in repairs are more effective.
Grateful for your diligent assistance, the technician you've helped kit out has decided to teach you a thing or two about field maintenance, allowing you to make more efficient repairs yourself.
You have unlocked the "Mechanized Warfare" achievement.
Tourist
Your keen familiarity with the Zone has allowed you to deduce the whereabouts of some of its best stashes.

Despite the dangers, you have explored all accessible parts of the Zone. From the murky depths of the Great Swamp to the alien landscape of the Generators... you know the Zone like the back of your hand.
You have unlocked the "Tourist" achievement.
Rag and Bone
You occasionally find more loot when searching stashes.
After gaining extensive experience poking around in other stalkers' stashes, you've grown wise to false bottoms and secret pouches where additional goodies might be squirreled away.
You have unlocked the "Rag and Bone" achievement.
Completionist
All available achievements have been unlocked.
All there is to achieve has been achieved. The road has been long, but you've arrived at the end triumphant.
You have unlocked the "Completionist" achievement.
Wishful Thinking
You've unlocked "Renegades" as a playable faction.

You did whatever it took to obtain secret knowledge from one of the oldest stalkers of the Zone. While you're skeptical he revealed the whole truth to you, what you accomplished in the quest for knowledge cannot be denied.
You have unlocked the "Wishful Thinking" achievement.
Down to Earth
Mi-2 helicopters will appear in place of Mi-24s.
The higher they fly the harder they fall. Not willing to waste any more expensive equipment, the Zone's helicopters now seem to be of a much weaker variety. But are no less tempting to destroy.
You have unlocked the "Down to Earth" achievement.
Geologist
You have an increased chance of finding artefacts after an emission.
Humming, buzzing and spitting - the anomalies of the Zone do not scare you any longer. Your extensive experience with detectors additionally makes artefacts easier to find.
You have unlocked the "Geologist" achievement.
Folk Hero
You can recruit larger groups of followers to act as your companions.

Your exploits have begun to establish you as a local legend, and you carry yourself with a clear confidence that only experience can bring. Larger groups of stalkers are more willing to place themselves directly under your leadership, believing you'll lead them to success.
You have unlocked the "Folk Hero" achievement.
Bookworm Food
Memory sticks will be replaced by rare PDAs when spawned.
Through your own endeavours or by reading about those of others, you have come to learn a lot about the Zone and its many inhabitants. Perhaps you should consider sharing some of this knowledge?
You have unlocked the "Bookworm Food" achievement.
Infantile Pleasure
You're likely to recover more loot from boxes you destroy.

Storage crates now tremble at your approach, for hundreds of their boxy brethren have been broken at your hand. You have since elevated box breaking to an art form, cracking them open with minimal damage to the contents within.
You have unlocked the "Infantile Pleasure" achievement.
Vigilant Recycler
You have a slight chance to recover additional material during disassembly.
Believing that every part counts, you cannot help but break down junk into more useful components. After much experience, you have become more precise. Waste not, want not.
You have unlocked the "Vigilant Recycler" achievement.
Artificer Eagerness
Crafting requires one or two less components.
Crafting your own equipment has always been an empowering process, but now your increased experience in the matter has allowed you use your components with greater efficiency.
You have unlocked the "Artificer Eagerness" achievement.
Unforeseen Guest
You are less likely to draw suspicion or be discovered while disguised.

You've grown more familiar with the subtle customs of your enemies, and as a result your disguises are more convincing. Because of this, your various slip-ups in other areas are more likely to be overlooked, seen as nothing more than the quirks of a quiet, well-meaning guest.
You have unlocked the "Unforeseen Guest" achievement.
Absolver
You've unlocked "Sin" as a playable faction.
When the dark stalkers of Sin stepped forth to bring their vision upon the world, you stood against them, giving the world a chance to sort itself out without the manipulation of the noosphere.
You have unlocked the "Absolver" achievement.
Collaborator
You've unlocked "UNISG" as a playable faction.
For better or worse, you chose your side and made your decision. It's hard to tell if you were wrong or right...but you made it. And one guesses you should be thankful for that.
You have unlocked the "Collaborator" achievement.
Iron Curtain
You have been awarded a 50,000 RU bonus for your contribution to the faction's war effort.

Your faction has become an indisputable force within the Zone, with lesser groups even considering it a local superpower. The spoils of war are already being divided, and a healthy dividend has come your way.
You have unlocked the "Iron Curtain" achievement.
Murky Spirit
Your rank has been greatly increased.
You have soundly survived events that would've killed most stalkers several times over. Some stalkers are beginning to wonder if you can even be killed at all.
You have unlocked the "Murky Spirit" achievement.
Invictus
You can now take a screenshot and brag about this achievement to your fellow stalkers.

Despite the vicious vicissitudes thrown your way, you have proven yourself to be a resounding success. It is clear that there is nothing left in the Zone to challenge you, and that it may be time to move on to even greater things.
You have unlocked the "Invictus" achievement.
